name: method-ui

accordion.name: Accordion
accordion.description: A vertically stacked set of interactive headings that each reveal a section of content.

examples.title: Basic
examples.source: What is React? React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It allows developers to create reusable UI components. What is Solid? SolidJS is a declarative, efficient, and flexible JavaScript library for building user interfaces with fine-grained reactivity. What is Vue? Vue is a progressive framework for building user interfaces, designed to be incrementally adoptable.

examples.title: Collapsible
examples.description: Allow all panels to be closed
examples.source: Can I close all items? Yes! With the collapsible prop, you can close all accordion items by clicking the open item. Is it animated? Absolutely. The accordion uses smooth CSS animations for opening and closing.

examples.title: Multiple
examples.description: Allow multiple panels to be open simultaneously
examples.source: Features Full keyboard navigation, collapsible items, and smooth animations built-in. Accessibility Complies with WAI-ARIA design patterns and supports screen readers. Styling Fully customizable with Tailwind CSS and class variance authority.

examples.title: Outlined
examples.source: Installation Install the package using your favorite package manager: npm install @ark-ui/solid Usage Import the components and start building your accordion UI with full TypeScript support. Customization Use CVA variants and Tailwind classes to customize the look and feel.

examples.title: Disabled
examples.source: Available This accordion item is available and can be toggled. Disabled This item is disabled and cannot be opened. Enabled This accordion item is also available.

checkbox.name: Checkbox
checkbox.description: A checkbox component that allows users to select one or more items from a set. Use Checkbox for simple cases, or compose with CheckboxRoot, CheckboxControl, CheckboxIndicator, and CheckboxLabel for full control.

examples.title: Basic Checkbox
examples.source: <Checkbox>Accept terms and conditions</Checkbox>

examples.title: Checkbox Group

dialog.name: Dialog
dialog.description: A modal dialog component with composable parts. Uses Ark UI for accessibility and focus management.

examples.title: Basic Dialog
examples.description: A simple dialog with trigger, title and description
examples.source:
<Dialog>
  <DialogTrigger>
    <Button>Open Dialog</Button>
  </DialogTrigger>
  <DialogContent>
    <DialogTitle>
      Dialog Title
      <Badge variant="secondary" class="ml-2">
        New
      </Badge>
    </DialogTitle>
    <DialogDescription>
      This is a basic dialog with a title and description.
    </DialogDescription>
    <DialogFooter>
      <DialogClose>
        <Button variant="outline">Close</Button>
      </DialogClose>
    </DialogFooter>
  </DialogContent>
</Dialog>

examples.title: Controlled Dialog
examples.source:
const dialog = createDialogState();
return (
  <>
    <Button onClick={dialog.open}>Open Dialog</Button>
    <Dialog
      open={dialog.isOpen()}
      onOpenChange={(e) => dialog.setOpen(e.open)}
    >
      <DialogContent>
        <DialogTitle>Controlled Dialog</DialogTitle>
        <DialogDescription>
          This dialog is controlled by external state using the
          createDialogState helper.
        </DialogDescription>
        <DialogFooter>
          <Button variant="outline" onClick={dialog.close}>
            Close
          </Button>
        </DialogFooter>
      </DialogContent>
    </Dialog>
  </>
);

examples.title: Dialog with Form
examples.source: Edit Profile Make changes to your profile here. Click save when you're done.

input.name: Input
input.description: A composable form input component built with Ark UI Field. Components: InputRoot (wrapper), InputLabel, Input, Textarea, Select, InputHelperText, InputErrorText, InputRequiredIndicator. Use Input alone for simple cases, or compose with InputRoot for full control over labels, errors, and helper text.

examples.title: Simple Input
examples.description: A standalone input without Field wrapper
examples.source: <Input placeholder="Enter text..." />

examples.title: Input with Label
examples.description: Complete form field with label and helper text
examples.source:
<InputRoot>
  <InputLabel>Email</InputLabel>
  <Input type="email" placeholder="Enter your email" />
  <InputHelperText>We'll never share your email</InputHelperText>
</InputRoot>

examples.title: Input with Error
examples.description: Input with error state and required indicator
examples.source:
<InputRoot invalid required>
  <InputLabel>
    Password
    <InputRequiredIndicator />
  </InputLabel>
  <Input type="password" placeholder="Enter password" />
  <InputErrorText>Password is required</InputErrorText>
</InputRoot>

examples.title: Textarea
examples.source:
<InputRoot>
  <InputLabel>Message</InputLabel>
  <Textarea autoresize placeholder="Enter your message..." />
  <InputHelperText>This textarea will grow as you type</InputHelperText>
</InputRoot>

examples.title: Input Sizes

menu.name: Menu
menu.description: A menu component for displaying actions and options. Built on Ark UI Menu - all Ark UI Menu props are supported.

props.name: ids

examples.title: Context Menu with Nested Items
examples.description: Right-click anywhere in the area to open context menu
examples.source:

SVG

examples.title: Button Trigger with Icons
examples.description: Menu with button trigger and icon items
examples.source:
<Menu>
  <MenuTrigger variant="outline">
    <div class="i-lucide-settings h-4 w-4 mr-2" />
    Actions
  </MenuTrigger>
  <MenuContent>
    <MenuItem value="new">
      <div class="i-lucide-file-plus h-4 w-4 mr-2" />
      New File
    </MenuItem>
    <MenuItem value="open">
      <div class="i-lucide-folder-open h-4 w-4 mr-2" />
      Open File
    </MenuItem>
    <MenuItem value="save">
      <div class="i-lucide-save h-4 w-4 mr-2" />
      Save
    </MenuItem>
    <MenuSeparator />
    <MenuItem value="settings">
      <div class="i-lucide-settings h-4 w-4 mr-2" />
      Settings
    </MenuItem>
    <MenuItem value="exit">
      <div class="i-lucide-log-out h-4 w-4 mr-2" />
      Exit
    </MenuItem>
  </MenuContent>
</Menu>

select.name: Select
select.description: A select component that allows users to choose from a list of options. Built with Ark UI for full accessibility and keyboard navigation.

examples.title: Basic Select
examples.description: Simple single select with text items
examples.source:
<Select>
  <SelectPlaceholder>Select a Framework</SelectPlaceholder>
  <SelectItem value="react">React</SelectItem>
  <SelectItem value="solid">Solid</SelectItem>
  <SelectItem value="vue">Vue</SelectItem>
  <SelectItem value="svelte">Svelte</SelectItem>
</Select>

examples.title: With Icons
With Groups
Multiple Select
examples.source:
<Select multiple>
  <SelectPlaceholder>Select frameworks</SelectPlaceholder>

  <SelectItem value="solid">Solid</SelectItem>
  <SelectItem value="vue">Vue</SelectItem>
  <SelectItem value="svelte">Svelte</SelectItem>

slider.name: Slider
slider.description: A slider component for selecting values within a range. Built on Ark UI Slider - all Ark UI Slider props are supported.

examples.title: Basic
examples.description: A simple slider with label and value display
examples.source:
<Slider
  label="Volume"
  showValue
  defaultValue={[50]}
  max={100}
  step={1}
/>

examples.title: Range Slider
examples.description: A slider with two thumbs for selecting a range
examples.source:
<Slider
  label="Price Range"
  showValue
  defaultValue={[25, 75]}
  max={100}
  step={1}
/>

examples.title: With Custom Steps
examples.description: A slider with decimal step increments
examples.source:
<Slider
  label="Opacity"
  showValue
  defaultValue={[0.5]}
  min={0}
  max={1}
  step={0.1}
/>

examples.title: Disabled
examples.source:
<Slider
  label="Disabled"
  showValue
  defaultValue={[60]}
  max={100}
  disabled
/>
